info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 13 at 6:57PM CDT until June 13 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN MILLER COUNTY...NORTHWESTERN CADDO PARISH IN NORTHWESTERN LOUISIANA AND EAST CENTRAL CASS COUNTIES... At 657 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Bivins, or 5 miles southwest of Atlanta, moving east southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Atlanta, Queen City, Hosston, Rodessa, Ida, Bivins, Ravanna, Brightstar, Bloomburg, Fort Lynn and Kiblah. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
